Package com.example.goldencarrot.data.model.waitlist

Class WaitList

java.lang.Object
com.example.goldencarrot.data.model.waitlist.WaitList
All Implemented Interfaces:
WaitListConfigurator
public class WaitList extends Object implements WaitListConfigurator
The WaitList class represents a waiting list for an event. It stores the event associated with the waitlist and the list of users who are on the waitlist. This class provides functionality to add users to the waitlist, remove users, and check if the waitlist has reached its limit.

  • Constructor Details

    • WaitList

      public WaitList()
      Default constructor for initializing an empty waitlist. Initializes the user list as an empty ArrayList.

    • WaitList

      public WaitList(int limitNumber, String waitListId, String eventId, ArrayList<UserImpl> userArrayList)
      Constructor to initialize the waitlist with specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      limitNumber - the maximum number of users allowed on the waitlist.
      waitListId - the unique ID of the waitlist.
      eventId - the ID of the event associated with the waitlist.
      userArrayList - the list of users currently on the waitlist.

    • addUserToWaitList

      public boolean addUserToWaitList(UserImpl user)
      Adds a user to the waitlist if the list is not full. If the waitlist is full, the user is not added, and false is returned. If the waitlist is not full, the user is added, and true is returned.
      Specified by:
      addUserToWaitList in interface WaitListConfigurator
      Parameters:
      user - the user to add to the waitlist.
      Returns:
      true if the user was added, false if the waitlist is full.

    • getWaitListId

      public String getWaitListId()
      Returns the unique ID of the waitlist.
      Specified by:
      getWaitListId in interface WaitListConfigurator
      Returns:
      the waitlist ID as a String.

      Parameters:
      waitListId - the ID to set for the waitlist.

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Checks if the waitlist has reached its limit.
      Returns:
      true if the waitlist is full, false otherwise.
